main event: On 6 November 1957 in Tucson, Arizona, a clear, almost still sky, an unidentified object with a sharp reddish glow was observed for 6 minutes, displaying definite flight characteristics before disappearing in the distance.
interesting points: The object went from 18 to 70 degrees elevation in 15 seconds.
There was no sound or zig-zag motion associated with the object.
The sighting was categorized as 'Unknown' with no conclusive explanation provided.
The object displayed changing colors from red to orange before slowly disappearing.
Witnesses include multiple individuals from Tucson, Arizona, including a housewife and firefighters.
sighted object: unidentified object with a sharp reddish glow
witnesses: multiple individuals including a housewife and firefighters
